title: Bug Skateboards - Small Trick Complex
description: Small Trick Complex is Ross LeBlanc's latest contribution to the vibrant community skateboarding scene. Ross recently created this video for Bug Skateboards, a fresh Montreal-based brand. Through inspiring camaraderie, these skateboarders truly embody the essence of community leadership. Be sure to watch the video and see for yourself!

title: TV Skateboards - Promo
description: Filmed over late Spring and Summer of 1992. The only TV Skateboards footage that has ever seen the light of day. Jerry Fowler, Jahmal Williams, Mike V, and Ed Templeton.

title: Picture Show - The Eye
description: From broken sidewalks to foaming fountains, Jasper Steve, Moose Abrams, John Baragwanath, Taylor Nawrocki, and squad rip their way from Miami to NYC in this raw vision of the East Coast.

title: Cold Sweat
description: "A skateboarding compilation video shot entirely on film. Includes coverage of the 1995 Hard Rock Cafe World Championships Of Skateboarding and Thrasher's Battle Of The Bay as well as a collection of photos by Seu Trinh."

title: Visual Traveling - The Persian Version
description: Skateboarding has once again taken us to a bizarre part of the world. Never thought we would be filming tricks in downtown Tehran, Iran if you asked me a couple years ago. Enjoy a journey from Iran to Turkey via the usual land transportation in our continuous trek zigzagging around the Eurasian peninsula.

Chicago's Finest, Skateboarding In The Streets Of Chicago Vol 2.

title: Elephant Direct
description: Elephant Direct is a visual project by two of skateboarding’s most traditional filmmakers, Jeremy Elkin and Jason Auger. Following in the spirit of Elkin’s "Lo-Def", here the work is compounded into a temporary online stream that serves as a tribute to the working class. In today’s post-‘throwaway’ era, senses and memories are all too regularly put under a general anesthetic at the hands of both over saturation and too many nameless kids doing 360 shove-its better than you could. And consequently, the relationship we form with skate videos rarely extend beyond a one-night stand of gross hyperbole and pressing a fucking ‘like’ button. Enter Elkin and Auger, determined to maintain that sense of mystery and memorable hand-made personality that made the likes of Video Days what it is: something that can never be described as ‘throwaway’.

title: Manik - Urban Rubble
description:
"The video starts with iconic footage of skaters sneaking up onto the top of the Kingdome and the further planned destruction of the iconic Seattle sports landmark (hence the name Urban Rubble). From there on, 40+ minutes of Seattle history on a piece of wood linked to four wheels begins." -Mitch Pfeifer of respectmyregion.com.

James Carlson forever.

Musicians Credited:
Dynomite D, Clay Wheels, Audible Preset, E.M. Bodwick, Verse Omega, Stingshark, Phat Sidy Smokehouse, Slantooth And Demo, Mic Makers, Specs One, D Valentino.
